page.title: 05HOUSING
page.content: There is one area in Hinderclay which is relatively more densly populated and to a lesser extent one area in Thelnetham. The rest of the housing is in small clusters of houses & isolated individual houses. Most houses have quite large gardens, and many have a meadow or paddock enclosed; several of these were probably smallholdings, although none are worked as such now. Some of the occupants now keep a pony, donkey, a few sheep, or goats on these meadows, and many people keep a few chickens in the backyard. The area is designated as a non-development area, with any housing development restricted to infilling and none outside the present area designated as residential.
